oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - The Earl Scruggs Review - 2006-05-20 - Tape one
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion on the Earl Scruggs Review from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 20, 2006. Tape one of two. In support of the exhibit Banjo Man: The Musical Journey of Earl Scruggs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Earl Scruggs; Gary Scruggs; Randy Scruggs; Eddie Stubbs;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Includes selected recorded audio excerpts. Opening comments by Jay Orr. Moderated by Eddie Stubbs. Introductions of panelists. Subjects include; The beginnings of the Review -- Originations of the name -- Scruggs brothers first recordings -- Earl stopping playing with Lester Flatt -- Charlie Daniels contributions -- Musical direction inspirations -- Audio excerpt from the album Earl Scruggs Review Live at Kansas State -- Steve Scruggs contributions -- Randy's fiddle playing -- Earl being able to play with his sons -- Record label interest -- Audio excerpt from video -- Billy Joel -- Recorded audio excerpt -- Louise Scruggs involvement in the business side -- Earls' story about Louise Scruggs' problem solving regarding the Flatt and Scruggs Live at Carnegie Hall and Live at Vanderbilt University album - Contributions of Louise Scruggs and her vision --

Louise's caution regarding Flatt and Scruggs appearing on the Beverly Hillbillies television show -- Audio excerpt -- What record producers brought to their recordings -- Being signed by Columbia Records New York rather than Nashville -- Differences in playing the banjo acoustically and electric -- Playing festivals and nightclubs -- Performing Internationally.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scruggs, Earl; Scruggs, Randy; Scruggs, Gary; Stubbs, Eddie; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
